newsitem.title: CHILE: Brokers for Banco Santiago stake sale named.
newsitem.headline: Brokers for Banco Santiago stake sale named.

text.p: The Central Bank said it named investment banks Goldman Sachs and Merrill Lynch as global coordinators and bookrunners for the international sale of its 38.5 percent stake in Banco Santiago.
The reference to the "international sale" of the shares gave credence to reports that the Central Bank plans to sell the shares to a foreign investor or investors.
The Central Bank received the package of Banco Santiago shares last week when the private institution paid off its subordinated debts to the Central Bank in the form of shares.
The debts were left over from Chile's financial crash of the early 1980s when the Central Bank bailed out several failing financial institutions.

The decision to name Goldman Sachs and Merrill Lynch "was taken after several weeks of analysis of the proposals and after carrying out meetings with each one of the investment banks invited to participate in the process called by the Central Bank," said a statement issued by the institution.
